author: Sun Tzu
summary: The art of war recognizes nine varieties of ground, each requiring different strategies. Rapidity is the essence of war. Throw soldiers into positions whence there is no escape, and they will prefer death to flight. The skillful general conducts his army as if leading a single man.
key_takeaways: Nine types of ground require nine different strategic approaches.
Rapidity is the essence of war - take advantage of the enemy's unreadiness.
Place your army in deadly peril, and it will survive - desperation creates extraordinary performance.

questions.question: According to Sun Tzu, what is 'the essence of war'?
questions.explanation: Sun Tzu declares: 'Rapidity is the essence of war: take advantage of the enemy's unreadiness, make your way by unexpected routes, and attack unguarded spots.'

questions.question: Sun Tzu says 'Throw your soldiers into positions whence there is no escape, and they will prefer death to flight.' What psychological principle does this reveal?

options.text: Soldiers should always be punished for retreat
When escape is impossible, people tap into extraordinary reserves of courage and capability

questions.explanation: Soldiers in desperate straits lose the sense of fear. If there is no place of refuge, they will stand firm. This is the psychological principle of 'burning the boats' - eliminating retreat options focuses all energy on success.

questions.question: Sun Tzu says 'The skillful general conducts his army just as though he were leading a single man, willy-nilly, by the hand.' What does this metaphor teach about organizational leadership?

options.text: Armies should be small, like one person
Through clear communication, shared purpose, and coordinated systems, large organizations can move with the unity and responsiveness of an individual

questions.explanation: This describes the ideal of unified command and organizational coherence. Through proper systems, communication, and leadership, large groups can act with the decisiveness and coordination of a single individual.
